Description: Rim sherd of Laconian, probably black-figured, pottery kylix; creamy slip; top of lip glazed inside and out; interior: very worn pomegranate pattern band; exterior: myrtle-branch band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the Naukratis Painter's rim decoration, see Leipzig T 3311 from Cerveteri.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 114, no. 399, p. 133, no. 399, p. 209, no. 399, pl. 84, no. 399)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 239)
Venit 1985 / Laconian Black Figure Pottery in Egypt (p. 395, no. 5, pl. 42, fig. 3-4)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 549, no.E 6, pl. XXXIX, pl. CCLXI)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.61) (phase 3)
